episodeTitle: It's an Emergency! The Ryugu Palace Is Occupied!
description: The Straw Hats are forced to take King Neptune and his guards hostage as a tactical maneuver while Nami uses bubbly coral to create breathable air in the palace. Luffy prepares to help Shirahoshi leave her tower and visit the Sea Forest.

events.title: The Straw Hats Take Neptune Hostage
events.description: With guards surrounding them and threatening to pop their air bubble, the Straw Hat Pirates are forced to take King Neptune and his men hostage as a tactical maneuver to protect themselves.
events.significance: This decision makes the Straw Hats appear as criminals to Fish-Man Island's citizens, creating a misunderstanding that complicates their situation and plays into Hody Jones' plans.

quotes.text: We don't have a choice! If we want to survive, we have to take them hostage!
quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Explaining the tactical necessity of their actions

events.title: Nami Uses Bubbly Coral
events.description: Nami discovers and uses bubbly coral to fill the entire room with breathable air, solving the immediate crisis of the guards threatening to pop their air bubble.
events.significance: Demonstrates Nami's quick thinking and knowledge gained from studying the island's unique properties, saving the crew from suffocation.

quotes.text: I found some bubbly coral! I can make the whole room fill with air!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Discovering the solution to their air bubble problem

events.title: Chopper's Kung Fu Point Debut
events.description: Tony Tony Chopper debuts his new post-timeskip transformation, Kung Fu Point, using martial arts techniques learned during his two-year training on Torino Kingdom to easily defeat Neptune's soldiers.
events.significance: First appearance of Chopper's new combat form that combines elements of his previous Arm Point and Jump Point transformations, showcasing his growth during the timeskip.

quotes.text: I won't let you take Sanji away!
quotes.speaker: Chopper
quotes.context: Before demonstrating his new Kung Fu Point form

events.title: Fukaboshi Delivers Jinbe's Message
events.description: Prince Fukaboshi arrives at the palace and delivers Jinbe's crucial message to Zoro and the Straw Hats: they must not fight Hody Jones and instead meet Jinbe at the Sea Forest.
events.significance: Sets up the important meeting between Luffy and Jinbe at the Sea Forest, where crucial information about Fish-Man Island's history and Fisher Tiger will be revealed.

quotes.text: Do not fight Hody Jones. Jinbe is waiting for you at the Sea Forest.
quotes.speaker: Fukaboshi
quotes.context: Delivering Jinbe's critical message to the Straw Hats

events.title: Luffy's Harsh Honesty with Shirahoshi
events.description: Luffy repeatedly tells Shirahoshi that he doesn't like her because she's a crybaby, causing her to cry even more. Despite his harsh words, his actions show he cares about helping her.
events.significance: Establishes the unique dynamic between Luffy and Shirahoshi, where his blunt honesty contrasts with his genuine desire to help her achieve freedom.

quotes.text: I told you, I don't like crybabies!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Expressing his frustration with Shirahoshi's constant crying

events.title: Neptune Allows Shirahoshi to Leave the Tower
events.description: After learning about Vander Decken IX's threats and Luffy's promise to protect her, King Neptune gives his permission for Shirahoshi to leave Hard-Shell Tower for the first time in ten years.
events.significance: A pivotal moment that allows Shirahoshi to finally experience freedom and sets in motion events that will lead to major revelations about her powers and the island's fate.

quotes.text: Very well. You have my permission to take Shirahoshi to the Sea Forest.
quotes.speaker: King Neptune
quotes.context: Granting permission for his daughter to leave her tower

events.title: Shirahoshi Hides Inside Megalo
events.description: To secretly transport Shirahoshi out of the palace, Luffy has her hide inside Megalo the shark's mouth. Despite being a giant mermaid, she somehow fits inside the shark.
events.significance: A comedic yet practical solution that allows Shirahoshi to begin her journey to the Sea Forest while avoiding detection, showcasing the creative problem-solving typical of One Piece.

quotes.text: Get inside Megalo's mouth! We're going to the Sea Forest!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Explaining his plan to sneak Shirahoshi out

events.title: Luffy and Shirahoshi Depart for the Sea Forest
events.description: Luffy departs from Hard-Shell Tower with Shirahoshi hidden inside Megalo, heading toward the Sea Forest to meet with Jinbe and fulfill Shirahoshi's wish to visit her mother's grave.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of Shirahoshi's first journey outside in ten years and sets up the crucial meeting with Jinbe where major backstory will be revealed.

events.title: Citizens View Straw Hats as Criminals
events.description: News spreads throughout Fish-Man Island that the Straw Hat Pirates have occupied the Ryugu Palace and taken King Neptune hostage, making them appear as criminals to the island's citizens.
events.significance: Creates a major misunderstanding that complicates the Straw Hats' situation and inadvertently helps Hody Jones' plan to turn the island against humans.

quotes.text: We don't have a choice! If we want to survive, we have to take them hostage!
quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Explaining the tactical necessity of taking Neptune hostage

quotes.text: I found some bubbly coral! I can make the whole room fill with air!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Discovering the solution to their air bubble problem

quotes.text: Do not fight Hody Jones. Jinbe is waiting for you at the Sea Forest.
quotes.speaker: Fukaboshi

quotes.text: I told you, I don't like crybabies!
quotes.speaker: Luffy

quotes.text: Very well. You have my permission to take Shirahoshi to the Sea Forest.
quotes.speaker: King Neptune
quotes.context: Granting permission for Shirahoshi to leave

themes.description: The episode explores the theme of freedom through Shirahoshi's decade-long confinement and her first opportunity to leave the tower, juxtaposed with the Straw Hats taking Neptune hostage.
themes.symbolism: Shirahoshi's imprisonment in Hard-Shell Tower represents the larger theme of Fish-Man Island's isolation from the surface world.

themes.description: Despite appearing as criminals who took the king hostage, the Straw Hats are actually trying to help Fish-Man Island, creating a dramatic irony central to this arc.
themes.symbolism: The hostage situation mirrors the broader misunderstanding between humans and fish-men throughout the arc.

themes.description: Chopper's new Kung Fu Point demonstrates the growth all Straw Hats achieved during the two-year timeskip.
themes.symbolism: The new transformation represents not just physical growth but Chopper's maturation as a fighter.

characterSpotlights.development: Chopper debuts his new Kung Fu Point transformation, showcasing his growth during the timeskip and his dedication to protecting his crew.
keyActions: Defeats Neptune's soldiers with martial arts
quotes: I won't let you take Sanji away!

characterSpotlights.development: Nami demonstrates her intelligence and knowledge of Fish-Man Island's unique properties by using bubbly coral to save the crew.
keyActions: Creates breathable air in the room
quotes: I found some bubbly coral! I can make the whole room fill with air!

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy shows his characteristic blunt honesty with Shirahoshi while simultaneously demonstrating his willingness to help her achieve freedom.
keyActions: Promises to protect her from Vander Decken
Devises plan to sneak her out using Megalo
quotes: I told you, I don't like crybabies!
Get inside Megalo's mouth! We're going to the Sea Forest!

characterSpotlights.development: Shirahoshi takes a brave step toward freedom by accepting Luffy's help and leaving Hard-Shell Tower for the first time in ten years.
keyActions: Continues crying at Luffy's harsh words
Begins journey to the Sea Forest

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro takes charge of the situation at the palace, making the difficult decision to take Neptune hostage and receiving Jinbe's important message.
keyActions: Receives Jinbe's message about not fighting Hody
quotes: We don't have a choice! If we want to survive, we have to take them hostage!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expanded on Chopper's fight scenes with the guards, showing more of his Kung Fu Point abilities than the manga depicted.
Additional scenes showing the citizens' reactions to news of the palace occupation were added for dramatic effect.

trivia.fact: This episode features the first change in post-timeskip eyecatchers, now showing Zoro and Chopper instead of the previous characters.
Episode 533 achieved a TV rating of 10.6%, ranking 4th for its time slot in Japan.
Kung Fu Point is believed by fans to be a combination of Chopper's pre-timeskip Arm Point and Jump Point transformations.

sources.title: Tony Tony Chopper/Abilities and Powers - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The episode covers Chapter 614 (pages 2-9, 11-17) of the manga.
This is one of the episodes in the Fish-Man Island arc that was later remastered in the 2024 'One Piece Log: Fish-Man Island Saga' which shortened the arc from 62 episodes to 21 episodes.

sources.title: One Piece Log: Fish-Man Island Saga Anime - Anime News Network
